website_summaries.verdict: Dogs love plush toys, but since no pet owner enjoys cleaning toy fluff off the floor, Kong’s floppy hippo provides the best of both worlds in this strong yet soft toy with just a little stuffing.
pros: Extremely durable rope limbs and “skeleton.” Minimal internal stuffing
Great for small and medium breeds

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long at all. Not what I expected for a KONG toy.
customer_reviews.text: Good toy. My dog loved it However, within 1 night he had already ripped the toy open and had pretty much gutted it. I was hoping for more from a KONG product. I have a 90 pound German Shepherd. He is a big chewer and can be aggressive when ripping stuff apart. I really was looking for something more long lasting. Arrived quickly. he did love it while he was tearing up, so that was worth it for the night.
customer_reviews.author: shellyt

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great toy for my pup! I have an 85lb Goldendoodle who loves tug-of-war and this toy has held up surprisingly well. I love that there is no stuffing and even if he chews apart a knot the toy is still useable, just cut off the extra rope and keep playing. The fabric has held up to aggressive chewing and tugging and the squeakers both are going strong. I purchased a second toy from this series, the hippo, and it is holding up just as well.
customer_reviews.author: A. DennisTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: So, your dog is chewing shoes?
customer_reviews.text: Figured out that our lab needed something softer than her other chew toys after my 6th pair of shoes was mangled.. this does the trick. I dare you to try to pull this apart... can't be done. She carries the bunny everywhere and wants it in her crate with her at night. We call it "her baby." Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pace

customer_reviews.title: My boys LOVE these floppy knot toys
customer_reviews.text: My boys LOVE these floppy knot toys! They can destroy a toy in less than an hour, these however they dont for some reason. They will play tug and run around the yard with them. They are by no means indestructible.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: KONG toys don't hold up like I've heard
customer_reviews.text: This toy is very cute and our 7 month old puppy loves it...however...we received it on February 14th..today is the 21st and it's destroyed! The ears are gone and an entire foot. We've found string ha from this toy in his stools. I bought this item because I've heard nothing but good about these KONG toys. I'm really disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela K.

customer_reviews.title: My Jack Russell destroyed it in 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy for my Jack Russell (13 years old) and my Goldendoodle (6 years old) to play with together - tug of war. Well, they fought over it, so I put it away and bought another of the exact item from a different vendor (lower price). So now both dogs had their OWN "baby" to play with. Jack Russell Odette ripped its nose off and began pulling out all of the stuffing. That is not safe so I have to take it away. A lot of money for nothing. Goldendoodle Buddy is just a few minutes behind her, and his Fox's nose is hanging off with the stuffing coming out.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Doxie Love
customer_reviews.text: My Doxie could probably chew through a cement wall if he took a notion. Very, very strong chewer, so Kong is the only toy that lasts for a while with him. He loves his elephant and fox, carries them (his babies) around and cries. These have held up extremely well, the only place I've had to sew back together is at the side of the neck, otherwise they are still intact. I throw them in the washer/dryer when he has loved them till they are stinky which is impossible with a lot of other toys (which usually only last about an hour) Well worth the price for us.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dolan

customer_reviews.title: The toy was a the favorite of my dog for almost two whole days
customer_reviews.text: The toy was a the favorite of my dog for almost two whole days. My "mutt" has the "superpower" to chew up anything extremely fast. This toy lasted at least 2 hours until he had it tore into peices and that an hour and 45 minutes longer then any other toy we have bought him.The main body of the toy held up for a couple days (without limbs, stuffing or a head) before we threw.it away due to being in to many pieces. I won't buy gain because my dog is a little freak with super jaws, but this would be perfect for a normal dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: d loved her knots toy so this will be her second ...
customer_reviews.text: Based from past experience my g.s.d loved her knots toy so this will be her second one. It did last awhile which I was happy about. The outer part does get destroyed pretty quickly. I guess it will vary if your dog is an aggressive chewer as well as age. I'm glad this doesn't have fluffy cotton/plush in it. Its a cute toy and the price was decent. Happy purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ashes P.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible "Kong" and terrible seller
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because its a Kong, but the squeakers lasted less than 5 minutes. Now it's just a floppy, lumpy mess. I'd like to assume I just got a defective one but the seller is impossible to reach and has failed to respond. I'm also concerned that the seller REMOVED my review from their profile as I no longer see it on their storefront. Kong products are generally great, but do not buy from Beaver Creek Pet Supplies -- not trustworthy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doggo loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves to take anything that squeaks, and has fluff, and destroy it. Once it is a shell of its former existence it lasts forever and he wont shred it. I liked this because it said there was no stuffing, which isn't true because the Hippo's head is full of fluff, and a squeaker. Took my boy Koda about 1 second to figure that out, and about 5 minutes to eat his brains (the fluff and squeaker). All in all its built well, playing tug-o-war with a 100lb Siberian/Bernese and it hasn't torn in half yet. Its a good combo of Rope toy and stuffed animal so we will see how long it lasts!
customer_reviews.author: joey Walker

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could give 0 stars
customer_reviews.text: I have a french bulldog. Within an hour she had eaten the ear off this toy and it caused major issues. She ended up having emergency surgery to remove it along with the blockage it caused. Kong was supposed to be strong. Vet Bills were over $1k and she has a rather large bandage covering all those stitches. She may not be able to eat regular food again. Thanks Kong. I feel terrible for giving her this toy.
customer_reviews.author: JOE LEDET

customer_reviews.title: Great long lasting toy.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got a big 90lb pit mix that is a big time chewer. We have a hard time buying him any kind of stuffed animal toy as they don’t last long. This was a fantastic compromise. We had bought him a Kong elephant, and it has lasted a very long time, but was needing replaced. I almost bought him a new one when I saw this toy. So far, so good. No stuffing to tear out. Just durable ropes. It’s the longest lasting “stuffy” we’ve bought him so far. Very happy with it. And he’s so proud of it. Carts it around with him everywhere and can’t sleep without it. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Formby

customer_reviews.title: Came apart at the seam
customer_reviews.text: Update I changed my rating from 4 stars to 5 stars. I was contacted and asked if I wanted a refund or a new bunny toy. I opted for the bunny toy and it arrived today. Great customer service! I have a small 6 month old shih tzu puppy. She loves her kong bunny but it came apart at the lower back seam after having it less than 12 hours. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lord

customer_reviews.title: The fabric limbs and ears on this almost immediately detached ...
customer_reviews.text: The fabric limbs and ears on this almost immediately detached from the body and head upon a vigorous tug session with our dog. Due to the knots at the ends of these extremities, they did not come off so the appearance isn't affected much. Our dog enjoys it as he does most any tugging toy and he has not yet chewed through it yet although that's sure to happen soon as that's his thing and it doesn't seem to be made of a material that would prevent it.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip U.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but unloved
customer_reviews.text: The pros: This toy has lasted longer than any other similar toy. When he plays with it, he can't find anything to tear up or shred, so it's holding up really well. The cons: He doesn't really like it, even if I pick up all his other toys and this is his only option. I have to initiate play with this and even then, he sometimes isn't interested. Might get 2-3 rounds of fetch and tug before he loses interest. Doesn't even rank in his top-10 favorite toys. Also, no squeaker, which is a huge disappointment for him.
customer_reviews.author: S. Olson

customer_reviews.title: He Messed Up the Bunny Pretty Bad
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas Gift. The recipients large breed dog really enjoyed it. He ripped it apart within hours, but that's what he does to all his stuffed toys, so it's not any evaluation of the toys quality. It's a large breed dog. It's kind of just an accepted thing that he occasionally gets an inexpensive stuffed toy to "Mess It Up." Ok, the owner doesn't use the term "Mess it up", they substitute the word "Mess" with something else, but I didn't want to offend sensibilities. He really enjoyed it, squeekers and all... :D
customer_reviews.author: The Glass Box

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: *update, I bought 2 more and have 4 now, first 2 are rags rags w ropes but the dogs took better care of the new ones, having a great time, highly recommend* I read a review that said odds are a heavy chewer will rip it open but not much stuffing and very little mess. It is PERFECT, 120 pound Lab destroys all toys in minutes. This lasted overnight and yes a little stuffing came out, no big deal and the inside is another toy. 3 years I've tried toys and this is the first one that lasted.
customer_reviews.author: JeanM

customer_reviews.title: Kong with a miss.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with low expectations as my 2yr old husky murders anything with plush/squeakers. I thought with this one having rope it would last but it didn't make it an hour before there were stuffed animal insides strewn about the floor. The rope has been shredded to strands and the squeakers are being pulverized as I write this. I am quite sure there will never be a plush toy that my husky can't destroy in less than an hour. If your dog is a chewer that loves to remove the insides and get those squeakers out, this isn't the toy for you.
customer_reviews.author: LayzeeHero

customer_reviews.title: Great size, design, durability
customer_reviews.text: These are our #1 dog toy. Great for throwing, catching, tugging, multiple dog play. Minimally stuffed. We have the rabbit, fox, and newest...the elephant. Our 1yo rough collie wont chew up any portion of them (usually any small part of a toy gets chewed off quick). I think the rope is the key here! It acts as endcaps for limbs and internal “skeleton”. Paired with the fabrics used, great design. I would recommend for dogs who need durable toys. (Extreme chewers and destructive dogs would enjoy, but likely wear it out much quicker)
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: This was our 2nd "Foxy"
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loved this so much, I bought a second one when the first one was destroyed. I just through it away last week because my aggressive chewer, Goldendoodle puppy was devouring it at 7 months of age. He had chewed off and swallowed both ears and was already finding the small amount of stuffing in the toy. He began vomiting and coughing for several weeks after we threw it away. Only use while you are supervising your pet. Otherwise stick with the Kong Tractor Tire or other durable bones.
customer_reviews.author: JEF

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT For the Chewing Dog
customer_reviews.text: My Frenchie (who is a chewer and destroys EVERYTHING!) has not managed to make this toy look like it’s even been used. She chews on it all the time and you can’t tell. I love this toy and highly recommend. Wish I’d have discovered this before the 100 others that have gone to Toy Heaven. Lol
customer_reviews.author: MrsDude

customer_reviews.title: Surviving my two little dedicated chewers
customer_reviews.text: I have two rescue dogs: one is part spaniel, the other part husky. We have gone through many toys and chews. One “indestructible” toy didn’t even last 10 minutes and my spaniel had “killed” it and strewn its remains all over the living room. But the Kong toy (aka Mr Fox) is taking a licking and keeps on ticking! His hand is unraveled and he’s missing one ear but he still is good for the daily tug o’ war! If you also have fearsome chewers, I recommend giving this toy a try.
customer_reviews.author: eeoyrefan

customer_reviews.title: Our American Mastiff puppy LOVES IT!
customer_reviews.text: We just adopted an American Mastiff puppy with lots of very sharp teeth and she absolutely loves her bunny!! We use it as a tool to redirect when she starts to get "mouthy" with people. When we first got it, I did remove the squeaker from the stomach area of the bunny b/c I'm not a big fan of squeaking toys, but the bunny is still fully intact, and we'll see how long it lasts against our big girl's chompers!
customer_reviews.author: April W.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: My Chi split this thing open in less that 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: My Chi split this thing open in less that 5 minutes. Kong has responded that they do not warrant the Knot Toys. Meanwhile, the Rabbit Knot Toy (the Bun Bun) has withstood both my Chi's going at it hammer and tong for months.... go figure!
customer_reviews.author: kidkessy

customer_reviews.title: Be aware it’s the smaller size
customer_reviews.text: We have one of these in the bigger size and our dog loves it but I made a mistake (really I didn’t know that that was another size available) and ordered the small one (6 of them to be precise). It’s still great but quite small for a pit. However he still loves it and will keep all of them. The seems are not as well made as it should be so quickly figures out how to take it apart but I usually catch him doing it and sew them back together.
customer_reviews.author: Icicle4

customer_reviews.title: Puppies were tough on it
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes, my one puppy Loves all stuff animals and my other puppy likes to find a weak spot and pull and chew until it’s ruined... after 4 days of playing with this I found they both were chewing the foot and had unraveled part of the rope and tore it open. I took the rope out and I’m going to sew the foot to see if it lasts longer... i guess this is just what happens with super chewer puppies
customer_reviews.author: Christine B.

customer_reviews.title: Did not last with 11 month old Golden Retriever
customer_reviews.text: After reading so many positive reviews on longevity of this toy, I decided to give it a try. Any toy we give our puppy, he pulls out the squeaker. He was successful in about 5 minutes with this toy. In the next 5 minutes, he got the second squeaker. He then has managed to shred the rope all throughout the house. I would not recommend this toy, it’s did not last with a chewy golden retriever.
customer_reviews.author: Jaspers2010

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try a "soft toy" by Kong. I was hoping it would be a toy my dog wouldn't tear up in a week. Well not so much! He had the ears off in a day and a half and the rest of it pretty much demolish within the week. He is a 1 year old Boston "Terror" as we wr call him, and he demolishes ann Soft toys pretty quickly. At least this one did not have very much stuffing for him to spread all over the house.
customer_reviews.author: Smurfette

customer_reviews.title: Great long lasting toy
customer_reviews.text: This particular one was a gift for our friend's new puppy. We purchased because we have them for our dogs and they love them. I love that there isn't much "stuffing" other than the head. You know what I mean. We all end up with that fluff all over the place once they rip them up! Our pups are tough on toys and while they eventually get through these, they do last longer than others. And they're really cute!
customer_reviews.author: casemeister

customer_reviews.title: Lasted almost a week!
customer_reviews.text: This toy lasted almost a week, which is actually a record for our super chewer. She only likes the plush chewies, so they rarely last more than a day. So this is a pretty good product! I deducted a star because there is polyester stuffing in the head that was all over my carpet on Day 1. It's unnecessary. The inside is rope please don't stuff the head. But it won't stop me from buying another one!
customer_reviews.author: Kagome

customer_reviews.title: I would try to find another item if my dog wasn't so in love with "Mr
customer_reviews.text: It's suppose to have minimal stuffing but some have more than others. My dog loves this item so I keep buying them but when they arrive I have to cut them open, remove the stuffing and sew it again because he will chew it open within 2-3 days. I would try to find another item if my dog wasn't so in love with "Mr.Fox"
customer_reviews.author: H_Feuerbach

customer_reviews.title: Our puppy loves Mr. Fox
customer_reviews.text: Our little puppy loves Mr. Fox, as we call him. We had to get a second one after she tore apart the first one over several months. When she won’t stop running around and go to bed, this toy helps to distract her and calm her down. It’s somewhat durable - good enough for a puppy. The rope inside certainly helps. I’ve put this in the washing machine in a laundry bag and it gets clean, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah L.

customer_reviews.title: Not for my aggressive chewer
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love, but my dog destroyed it in a couple days. He ripped the back open after two days, and we had to dig out and throw away the stuffing. Then he got out the squeakers. Once he started unbraiding and shredding the interior ropes, we had to throw it away. For the few days it lasted my dog loved it and carried it around the house with him, so if you don't have an aggressive chewer this might work.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan H

customer_reviews.title: Passed!
customer_reviews.text: So far this toy has passed the Daisy test! She absolutely loves to throw this toy around with its appendages flailing all over the place. It is so fun to watch her play with it. She is an aggressive toy chewer but super gentle in everything else. Both my husband and I are amazed that she has not been able to eat a hole through it and pull out the squeakers (one in head and one in body). Will be purchasing again when/if necessary!
customer_reviews.author: His Daughter

customer_reviews.title: Durable but not indestructible
customer_reviews.text: I head for Kong anytime I want to get a toy for my German/Anatolian Shepherd toy-destroying 6-month old puppy. He loves this toy. He carries it to bed with him at night, and it's one of the first toys to come out in the morning. He has opened a seam on the side of the "torso," but he hasn't got far with it. Meanwhile, he shakes it, throws it, gnaws on it and (BONUS!) squeaks it. In Khan's world, toys must squeak.
customer_reviews.author: Stenella

customer_reviews.title: destroyed in 2 days
customer_reviews.text: Based on the reviews, I ordered this toy for my dog who loves to "attack" toys and chew the squeakers out of them immediately. I hoped this toy would last more than a few days. It did last more than the ones I buy at the dollar store (those last on average about 4 hours) but it still got totally destroyed within a couple days. The squeaker lasted about 20 minutes, then the stuffing came out slowly over the course of the next few days. I was very disappointed as I paid much more for this toy thinking it would be more sturdy. Nope, won't buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Blaylock

customer_reviews.title: Holds up for long lasting chewing and tugging!
customer_reviews.text: My non-stop chewing Boston Terrier absolutely loves this toy. It was the best purchase. There are only a few dog toy brands that I trust to hold up, and Kong is one of them. This particular toy has provided ongoing fun though. He quickly ripped out any stuffing, but there wasn't much in it. The skeleton of the toy is multiple ropes. HE LOVES IT. Continues to chew and thrash and suckle and carry this toy around with him a month later. Definitely held up and not too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: KONG Floppy Knots Dog Toy
customer_reviews.text: KONG Floppy Knots Dog Toy My 11-year old Jack Russell Terrier has played with this toy for at least a month now. It still holds its squeak and it has maintained its structural integrity. Doesn't look much like a hippo, but otherwise, the toy is good. This is the only reason I am giving it 4 stars. I would recommend this product to other buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Christina C

customer_reviews.title: Fox Sqeaky Toy
customer_reviews.text: This is the first toy my 10 week old Lab puppy got when we brought him home. He is an aggressive chewer. It has minimal stuffing, but he found every inch of it. the body is corderoy with ropes for legs and arms. The center belly is made of a VERY thin cotton material. My dog sucked and chewed on this and had it all eaten in less than 5 minutes. I do not know why they do not put a stronger material in the front body part. I repurchased another one on his 1st birthday and unfortunately he destroyed in the same amount of time. It needs stronger material.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie lagow

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy toys.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had the hippo and the fox for about 8 months and my 75 pound shepherd is very rough with them ( he prefers the hippo for some reason.) Both have held up very well. We play catch with them - he whips them around with his mouth - we even play tug of war with them. However, he is not an agressive chewer and I don’t think they would last long with my daughter’s pit bull mix who shreds tough toys in moments. They are good sturdy toys for non aggressive chewers.
customer_reviews.author: kim k

customer_reviews.title: Close to Indestructible
customer_reviews.text: I've learned over the years to skip any stuffed toys for my Corgi unless I want to be picking up wads of white fluff every day until I have to throw the toy out. The Kong duck has lasted over 2 years without any damage & still has an intact squeaker. I bought her the Kong fox which has multiple squeakers in it. We play tug-a-war & fetch with it & it's, thus far, very durable. I only buy Kong toys for her as they are the only dog toys I've found that she doesn't destroy quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Liz

customer_reviews.title: Little foxy did not make it
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this but it looks so cute but sadly my fur nephew destroyed and ate it within a month. I only am giving this three stars because he he loved it to pieces literally and it was a cute Christmas gift for him. I would suggest this product for someone who has a dog who's not so energetic and hard on toys .Maybe a couch potato senior.
customer_reviews.author: Ren

customer_reviews.title: One of my dogs favorite toys
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are chewers and destroy toys quickly. I bought this because there is no stuffing that they can eat or spread around the house, and also because it has six different appendages, which allows my dogs to play tug of war with it. After about six months, all that is left is the core knot structure, but that's impressive considering they destroy most soft toys within a few weeks. I ordered another one and it's still in great condition after one month.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Cross

customer_reviews.title: Great toy- doesn't last long for heavy chewers
customer_reviews.text: My Boxer and German Sheppard love to play tug-a-war with this toy. I have purchased many as they don't last long. My Boxer can easily chew through the fabric on the chest and take out the stuffing trying to reach the squeakers. It's by far the best toy I have purchased for them. They love the ropes but if you are looking for something indestructible, this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: This is really cute but I don’t think it’s meant for an aggressive chewer like my baby boy...he’s a pit so I’ve been ordering different toys that say they’ll last and they’re sturdy and I love Kong toys for him but this one was ripped apart within 24 hours...so there’s rope inside knotted and I thought that would be cool to play with for him but he unraveled it and ate some of the rope(I didn’t know he ate it at first) then he went to use the restroom and that’s when I found out he ate some of it. I’m sure this is good for dogs that don’t destroy toys but definitely not my big guy🤦🏼‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Amy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great body but face is stuffed
customer_reviews.text: These toys are THE BEST CONCEPT EVER! My dog loves them and because he tears ever toy apart within the first five minutes of having them, these are so smart. But why on earth would you make the face stuffed!? Every time I buy one that’s the first thing to go and there’s stuffing everywhere. Isn’t the whole concept of the toy to prevent that?
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: destroyed in 2 hours
customer_reviews.text: Bought this, and spent a pretty penny on it, thinking it will be durable as it is from Kong. It was destroyed in less than 2 hours. This is NOT for heavy chewers. Please do NOT leave this with your dog, he will eat pieces of the cloth. Tried to salvage the ropes underneath, but when you take the cloth out, the underlying rope frays. waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Amazing toy!!
customer_reviews.text: These toys are my dogs favorites! He loves the squeaking sound, the strong material and the knots!! The fact that there is the rope toy with knots all through the middle is great because it makes it tougher to rip through. He does eventually rip them up, but they last for months unlike the other stuffed toys that are gone in an hour. Very durable!
customer_reviews.author: Mary K. Field

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible by a fierce Chiweenie!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, LOVE this toy!! Sir Louie has not been able to destroy it! Oh, he has tried! He has put all 10 lbs of his nastiness into it. He has shook, thrown, dragged, zoom! ZOOM! Bit, chewed, bit again, chewed some more, then fell asleep, lol. Hippo still in tact! Mom doesn't have to clean up a million toy pieces or fluff from every surface of the house!!! Whoohoo!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa English

customer_reviews.title: Fox Kong dog toy
customer_reviews.text: Do my Australian Shepherd got an early Christmas present. While I was asleep, she tore and shredded the box her toy was in, got it out of the plastic bag and was so proud of herself jumped up in bed with me to show me her present. So I would say she LOVES it and it withstood the shredding of the box to get it!! It’s her favorite toy!
customer_reviews.author: Texan Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Great toy.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Boston Terriers. One year old brothers. They tear up everything! I decided I would not buy them another toy that was made of fabric but I took a chance and bought this Fox toy in the large size. They like to each grab an end and run with it together. It took them maybe 10 minutes if that to rip the fabric away and disembowel the toy and find the squeaker. But that's ok because they still have the heavy rope to play with. I only buy Kong toys for them. All of the rubber Kong brand toys I have bought for them are intact.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Q.

customer_reviews.title: Best stuffed king toy yet
customer_reviews.text: Very durable! The squeaker is somewhat small and not to easy to get to. So after 2 months, it’s still in place and no holes have formed. Also since it’s filled with ropes, there is minimal stuffing that dogs seem to always find and leave all over the house. Just an FYI, I have a full grown Great Dane and a Dane mix puppy (with puppy teeth) and neither of them are too destructive with anything. If your dog likes to rip everything apart within 5 minutes, this may not be durable enough and likely not worth your time or money. However, out of the 5 Kong stuffed toys I have bought, this one is the best made.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Hurtt

customer_reviews.title: Another KONG toy that we love
customer_reviews.text: I have a corgi that loves to destroy any toy he gets his paws on. Got this for him a few months ago and it survived for so long I couldn't believe it. It still lives among us, just without the ears and the arms. But he can still play with it. Love that the interior is not made of foam and just the knots. So when it opened up the house wasn't a mess.
customer_reviews.author: MARIA VICTORIA DE SOUZA PEREIRA

customer_reviews.title: My super chewer destroyed it quickly, but had fun doing it!
customer_reviews.text: I guess being a Kong product, I expected it to hold up better. Then again, this pup of mine is a high caliber chewer! He destroyed this toy pretty quickly, but he had fun doing it! I still have it around, but it's looking a mess. I will occasionally let him play with it, which makes him very happy, and will gather loose strings to throw away every five minutes. I'm happy I got it for him, because he enjoyed it, but I'm eager for him to mature to being a little gentler on his toys, if that's possible.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay L

customer_reviews.title: Was Expecting More
customer_reviews.text: Since this was a Kong product I was hoping it would be really tough. I need toys that don't have stuffing since my dogs like to tear those apart and spread stuffing throughout the house. Sadly they had this toy ripped open on the first day. Since it's rope inside my dogs are still playing with it, but it's unfortunate that it was destroyed so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: M. WalkerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good for little chewers too.
customer_reviews.text: I have a mixed terrier little guy. He is a fierce chewer. He loves his toys! All the stuffing comes out and then the squeaker all done in 5-10 minutes. This Kong Fox however has done pretty good. It’s been a whole day and it still looks somewhat like a fox! The chew knots are holding up on the inside. I rate as 4 stars because he still has managed to make a mess of the outer material, little pieces everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, no stuffing, 2 squeakers, bought a 2nd one we liked it so much!
customer_reviews.text: Update. Didn't see the size options! Love this product, quality is great, love that it has 2 squeakers & no stuffing. Our Akita puppy seems to like this one even with how small it is(bought the small one not realizing there were other sizes...it was late lol) Bought another one at our local Agway in a large size & he likes that one too.
customer_reviews.author: 1RadMomof5

customer_reviews.title: I have 2 rottweilers and they pretty much destroy every toy they get
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed how durable this is! I have 2 rottweilers and they pretty much destroy every toy they get, some within minutes....I took a chance and bought 3 different ones...the hippo, the bunny and the fox. Each one is still completely intact, and ones been almost 2 weeks now, and the bunny and hippo about a week. Unbelievable! Well worth the money and will buy more in future because my dogs love these toys!
customer_reviews.author: BuRny

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: My Teddy Roosevelt Terrier loves these things. He could totally tear one up in a week with his puppy teeth. I have a new one that I will give him now that he has his adult canine teeth almost fully in. We will see how long that one lasts. He still plays pull with the rope that was inside. The squeekers die first.
customer_reviews.author: CSATEXAS

customer_reviews.title: Decent toy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a ROUGH chewer, definitely aggressive. So...he tore this fox up quickly. But, he loved every second of it. It stayed together for a couple days, which is impressive. The rope base stayed together too, so despite the lack of fox body, it was still able to be played with.
customer_reviews.author: jl9988Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: despite her best efforts 🤣 I bought it to replace a previous ...
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong!!! My little Yorkie poo is tiny but she's got some TEETH on her.... Some SHARP ones at that! She loves this size toy (she's about 12 lbs) and hasn't torn through it yet, despite her best efforts 🤣 I bought it to replace a previous floppy knots toy. With the way she gnaws on things, I'm surprised the previous one lasted as long as it did! As long as long keeps making great quality stuff, I'm a loyal customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: ACW

customer_reviews.title: appropriate  for teething dogs, and toothless seniors
customer_reviews.text: As weak as they come. If your dog is a serious chewer this thing has hours to live tops. The fabric is not strong, it seconds before I heard it rip. The insides do have cotton filling, so if your dog eats stuff thats a danger. Lastly its just a rope toy inside, and since that will be all that survives you should just buy that for 5 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Plastik loser

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy and my pups best friend
customer_reviews.text: These are the only toys that we like giving to our dog. They are a stuffed toy, but incredibly sturdy especially against a 6 month old husky puppy. Our first one finally broke and lost very little stuffing after some incredibly wear and tear. The ropes through them really help them hold up. We now own the whole collection: Fox, rabbit, hippo, and elephant. And I recommend collecting them all for your pup too.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Jane Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Fail!!
customer_reviews.text: FAIL! I have looked, reviewed, & bought several dog toys for our Terrier. I thought I had finally found a toy that might last awhile. Not! This didn't even last an hour. So disappointed. I even paid a little more than I usually do for his toys for something I thought was quality. First, the belly squeaker was gone in less than 10 minutes then the head squeaker was gone in an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas Present
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as one of many different dog gifts (all unique) in 2019 because we are mostly dog people. I have to say it was almost a brawl as I dumped them in the middle of the floor and let everybody pick. This was especially popular as it was so cute and so sturdy. Definitely more like this next year!
customer_reviews.author: Y. A. Hobson

customer_reviews.title: PUPPIES FAVORITE TOY
customer_reviews.text: This is our goldendoodle puppies favorite toy! He loves chewing on the same toy for a long period of time and this is the only thing that has held up! Its great because it has a couple different textures. He loves the knot hands and feet. Plus..the squeaker is not obnoxious like a lot of other toys. :)
customer_reviews.author: Threedymodeler

customer_reviews.title: Not for the aggressive chewer!
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, our Shepsky (German Shepherd/Husky mix) is obsessed with pulling threads apart of whatever toy we give him. Let him find out there are some squeaky bits inside and he's on a mission! I was hoping this would last longer (we had the fox before) but the pics of day 2 show otherwise!.. The idea of the knots inside the toy is great, but I'll save my $ from now on and just buy him cheaper toys since the damage is done either way!..
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Good toy but my dog destroyed it within hours
customer_reviews.text: I have a Doberman puppy that’s a year old and chews constantly. I continually purchase “durable” toys to try out as it seems his mission is to see how quickly it can be rippped to shreds. This one made it a total of 3 hours before the insides were pulled out and I found pieces of it all of my house.
customer_reviews.author: Amandas Dean

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a month with my Boston Terrier and ...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted less than a month with my Boston Terrier and that was all that was expected really. When he gets mad with us and wants attention, he takes it out on his toys - nothing lasts long. We just needed it to squeak and buy me some time while I did housework. Be warned that it is a weapon if your dog swings it around in anger. One of the knots hit me in the head as it flew by from his ferocious shaking. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Imcega

customer_reviews.title: Tore open in 1 day and there is STUFFING
customer_reviews.text: My dogs tore this open within 1 day of getting it. I read that it did not have stuff but it did and it was all over my floor. I buy toys without stuffing because I know that none of them can stay together, however this did have stuffing after saying it did not. The dogs love it and the texture is really nice and thats why I am giving 4/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Maria Cuthrell

customer_reviews.title: Easily Destroyed
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to see a Kong toy like this. I figured it would be strong and not easily ripped apart. I have a chow/retriever mix who is an aggressive chewer. So I had high hopes for this. Sadly within less than 20 minutes it was destroyed. Not just the outside layer of the stuffed animal, but the rope inside too. Totally not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: shop777

customer_reviews.title: Not for super chewers
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed in this kong toy. Normally my pup takes a month or so to start to chew through her other Kong toys. We got the toy delivered last night around 6:00pm and she has already started to destroy it less than 12 hours later. However, it is very soft and she loves to squeak it and carry it around with her. If your pup is not a super chewer it is a great toy to have.
customer_reviews.author: Mavs2014

customer_reviews.title: Had since Mar 23
customer_reviews.text: This is one of two dogs toys that are my 2 dogs' 'go to' toy. It's seen better days, but 6 months is a long time in my household! The squeaker is exposed, but hasn't been removed which is remarkable for these two 'vicious' Maltese mixes. I like and trust Kong which is why I purchased it sight unseen.
customer_reviews.author: N. Drake

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think there was a toy that wasn’t hard rubber that my dog couldn’t chew or tear up. He loves cuddle toys and within hours or days the stuffing is every where. Thank you for making a cuddle toy that he can enjoy and I don’t have to pick up stuffing and pieces. This one is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Shalizzy

customer_reviews.title: This toy stands up to Kong's reputation for durability
customer_reviews.text: We have a black Labrador that usually destroys toys that are not made of anything but the Kong rubber. This toy is very durable. It has sturdy rope arms and legs and the body is made mostly of a fabric reminiscent of Sixties era fabric that is super durable. The blue part is denim, I think. He has played and chewed and pulled on this toy and has yet to do any damage to it. Gunner is seven years old. We have never seen him carry a toy around like this one. He brings it to bed with him!
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: rips easily/unsafe product
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt hold up. Ordered a medium/large size product. In about 5 hours time, cloth was torn and knot strings exposed. I have a 7 months Huskie. I have purchased the rubber Kong toys but this Kong product is very fragile in comparison. Eventually, I found ripped strands of thread in my puppy's mouth and backyard. Unsafe product. UPDATED 2nd PIC > bunny pet toy is torn and coming apart in less than 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: t c

customer_reviews.title: I’d give it 7 stars if I could
customer_reviews.text: One of the top five dog toys I’ve ever purchased in the past 20+ years of owning dogs. My guy can’t get enough of this and the rope knots are perfect for chewing on. The knot ends are a little heavy so if your dog does the “must kill the vermin by shaking it to death” shake when he plays, I would not recommend that you purchase this except for a 80+lb dog. But my guy (30 lbs) does a gentle shake and we’ve had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!  DESTROYED IN AN HOUR
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes that the toy would last after reading some of the reviews. My dog had it gutted out and torn apart within an hour. This photo was taken within an hour after she received the toy. Don't get me wrong, she LOVED the toy. Very disappointed. Also it states in the product information "With no stuffing for less mess" I'm calling BS on that one as you can see in the photo. Glad it was only $15. Never buying from Beaver Creek Pet Supplies again.
customer_reviews.author: Robian

customer_reviews.title: within 2 weeks stuffing coming out
customer_reviews.text: I went with Kong trusting the "indestructible" brand. but our 8 month old puppy, a big chewer, went through this in about 2 weeks. Once i see white stuffing, i remove the toy as i dont want that ingested. I was surprised to see the white fluff in a Kong. Can't recommend this toy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dogs loved it...
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 lab mixes and they love to play rough! I have a super chewer who makes it her mission to try to find any spare or lose thread. They have pulled all the "innards" out but the overall toy is still there. We let them play tug of war with it under supervision in case it comes apart more but they do both still love it!
customer_reviews.author: Beth N

customer_reviews.title: As Expected
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a power chewer and the Floppy Knots toys hold up longer than two days - - a true plus in my book. They can withstand "normal" tug-of-war play and bouts of gnawing on the limbs. A word of caution: The ears on this particular item do not have the knotted rope inside. They are easily shredded so you may want to keep a close eye on your pup during play and remove those bits of fabric from your fur baby's mouth.
customer_reviews.author: K.S.

customer_reviews.title: First I’d like to say my dog loves this toy
customer_reviews.text: First I’d like to say my dog loves this toy. The reason I gave it only 3 stars is because in less than a day she had shredded and destroyed all four legs and the tail, the ends only which are made of knotted rope that is not very durable, if your dog is a aggressive chewer they won’t last. So far the body is intact, I will update my review if she quickly destroys it.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Spaulding

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I have a moderate toy destroyer, and in all seriousness, this toy was destroyed within 5 minutes of giving it to my dog. The fabric on the belly ripped immediately and the stuffing and squeaker were destroyed. This also exposed the ropes which were ripped through and hanging out like the fox's disemboweled intestines. This was a terrible waste of $15, especially when advertised as a more durable toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Brown

customer_reviews.title: Cute and holding up so far!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a 60lbs puppy who likes to demolish toys in 5 seconds flat. However, this toy is holding up and she enjoys playing with it. She has also playfully chewed it - and the toy takes the abuse. After 3 days, the ears have been chewed off - but the rest of it is there. Sturdy enough to keep her interested in the toy. A perfect toy for a large puppy!
customer_reviews.author: GF4Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy! We have 2 floppy knot toys now. The fox and the hippo. Our dog loves them- she gets them to squeak and shakes them. I have washed fox 2 times and it held up great. We have a 7 month old English springer spaniel- she plays rough with her toys- but they have held up.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Slevoski

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value
customer_reviews.text: Our dog love these Kong toys. We've gotten him the Kong Knots bears and he's destroyed them all, but then we tried the Kong Floppy Knots and they hold up really well. He's had it for 6 weeks now and he's only begun to tear off the ear slightly, but otherwise it's still fully intact (and he's pretty rough with it). He loves the squeakers too. For size reference, it's a perfect play size for him and he is a fully grown adult Golden Retriever.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Your fur baby will love it!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered different types of toys for my fur babies, and this is luke’s Favorite; he drags and squeaks this thing everywhere he goes. Durability is ok as he already chewed off an ear, but it is expected. He has a lot of fun when the stuffing inside the toys is all over my floor; however, this toy does not have such.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Durable and lasts longer
customer_reviews.text: My dog is not all that big but 50 # of pure muscle. Most toys last hours. This one lasts a month with her. I order them monthly. It is no fun to have a bored herding dog in your house and life. She loves this toy and tosses it in the air as well as chews on it. She makes me play keep away with her in the mornings. Dog starter than owner for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret B. Everett

customer_reviews.title: My Dog is a Demon
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, this toy was built pretty tough. However, my 8 month lab only needed thirty minutes to fully pull it apart. The minimal stuffing was a nice touch, since the mess wasn't huge, but I probably wouldn't recommend it for dogs who are REALLY aggressive toy killers.
customer_reviews.author: TheZombieWoman

customer_reviews.title: Not a chew toy
customer_reviews.text: I just got this in the mail today. My 6 month old puppy had this for 5 minutes when I realized he chewed (and swallowed) the ear and was working on the squeaker. This toy is not a chew thing though it probably would work as a tug toy. Don’t leave your pup alone with it. I thought Kong was better than this.
customer_reviews.author: rcgr

customer_reviews.title: Toy falls apart the day you receive it, surprise...
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to purchase this toy initially, as it appeared it would be quite durable. The day we received it, our 2, 8 month old puppies destroyed it within 2 hours. Once they nipped through one rope, the remainder of the toy seemingly unwound and fell apart. It was really disappointing, since we were excited to try out this Kong rope toy. Save your money, or give the cash to your pups to chew on. The result will be ultimately be the same, and you will save the time on shipping...
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Manning

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Our 10 month old chocolate lab loves this thing. It’s the first toy he’s had like this that hasn’t been destroyed in under an hour. He’s had it for a few weeks now and he hasn’t even ripped any of the seams out. He’s an aggressive chewer, and this fox has definitely held its own against his shark-like teeth. He takes it everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful guy
customer_reviews.text: Love Kong rope toys, unfortunately, golden doodle grandpup loves them but can still destroy them. This one in good shape because he took him outside to live, bear looks like he plays for Chicago but even though he's a shell of his former self, he's loved. That's how 3 threes equal a 4.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Palinca

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and durable
customer_reviews.text: I have two labs that are “excessive chewers” and this toy lasts over a month. No other soft knot toy has ever lasted this long with them. I was skeptical and pleasantly surprised. Well designed with little stuffing, large secure squeakers (easy to remove with human hands you see them open up that area) and the internal knots provide chewing satisfaction along with a great tug of war between my pups.
customer_reviews.author: Christian B Staller

customer_reviews.title: Durable,stuffing free, even for my destructive chewer
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a toy that my tug of war loving chewing dachshund cannot tear up within an hour! My dachshund loves playing tug of war and chewing on his toys for hours. I have tried stuffing free toys, but he ends up eating stuffing and tearing it up super quick. These toys have thick rope inside, and durable fabric outside, with a squeaker or two in there. Had it a week, he is still going strong
customer_reviews.author: ct_nite

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I have a doberman and dachshund that love playing tug of war with stuffed animals and if course they never survive the day. This toy has lasted us over a month already with no tears. Definitely a must if you have a pup with a voracious appetite for stuffed animals. Ha!
customer_reviews.author: E&M

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for strong aggressive dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves his toy but within the first few minutes the ears are off and the stuffing is being pulled out. The rest of the toy last longer but there is a problem with the ears area. I do recommend this toy for aggressive destroyers like mine. Not many toys last longer than 5 minutes but this one does last. I have bought it more than 1 time so I am a return customer. I can not say that about most stuffed squeaky toys which is what my dog loves to play with
customer_reviews.author: Joy E.

customer_reviews.title: My dogs favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: My dogs LOVE these KONG Knots toys. I LOVE that they don't have fluff in them. My dogs broke his tail and all his insides now hang out like he has a super long tail, but other than that he is still in one piece. It is the longest we've had a stuffed toy in the house with a pit bull puppy, Catahoula chew monster, and a Yorkshire terrier!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan From JaMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Roping unraveled almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dog because she had the fox version of the same toy and it’s lasted her more than 6 months but is looking pretty beat up. The hippo is adorable but the roping unraveled almost immediately when she started playing with it. Now she has a long rope with what’s left of the hippo at the end of it. We’re really disappointed that it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: KONG Floppy Knots Dog Toy
product_meta.description: Size:Small/Medium| Style:Hippo| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingKONG Floppy Knots are the newest arrival in the Knots tribe with a cheerful, floppy design allowing for great thrashing fun. The realistic feel of the internal knotted rope satisfies natural instincts while the varied textures and squeakers gear up for play. With minimal stuffing for less mess get ready for entertaining games and grins. Covered by KONG Satisfaction Guarantee. See KONG Satisfaction Guarantee document below for full details.
feature_bullets: Internal knotted rope and floppy design satisfies natural instincts
Varied textures and squeakers to entice play

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
